intro: Paepalanthus catharinae var. catharinae, commonly known as the Catimba, is a rare flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is found in the Atlantic Forest biome. It has a short lifespan and is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
